explanation:
The correct equation combines two angles (f and f-20) around a point: \( f + (f - 20) = 360 \) → \( 2f - 20 = 360 \).

The student incorrectly wrote \( 2f - 20 = 180 \), implying they summed the angles to 180° instead of 360°.

This error stems from applying the rule for angles on a straight line (which sum to 180°) to a full rotation around a point (which requires 360°). 

The student recognized there were two angles but misapplied the geometric context, treating the diagram as a linear pair rather than a full circle. 

This directly aligns with confusing angle sums at a point with those along a line, not with adjacent angle misconceptions (which would require the angles to share a side) or circle angle misunderstandings (which involve arcs, not angles at a center point).
